definition: next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time

sentences.english: The school has an appropriate assessment system, e. g. frequency and arrangement of assessment, etc.
sentences.chinese: 学校的评估制度，例如评估的频次和安排等恰当。

sentences.english: The Six Sigma Black Belt should be able to read values from a cumulative frequency ogive.
sentences.chinese: 六西格玛黑带应该能够从累计频次分布中读出数值。

sentences.english: Rethinking can help you see how often you may be misinterpreting situations.
sentences.chinese: 转换思考能帮助你了解自己错误诠释处境的频次。

sentences.english: The effects of topping frequency on red wine aging in Chinese barrel were studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究不同添桶频次对中国橡木桶贮酒的影响。

sentences.english: The Minqin region is prone to dust storm.
sentences.chinese: 民勤地区是中国沙尘暴发生年频次最高的地区。

definition: number of times/frequency/order number (in a series)/power (math.)/degree of a polynomial (math.)
normalized (statistics)/to normalize (relations etc)/to become the norm
capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word
gap/interval/compartment/to divide/to separate/to leave a gap of (two weeks, three meters etc)
